nflPlayers.name: Lamar Jackson
nflPlayers.notes: Exploded in 2024 with 4,172 passing yards and 41 TD:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}, plus 915 rushing yards:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}. Finished as the #1 fantasy QB with 434.4 points:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

nflPlayers.name: Josh Allen
nflPlayers.notes: Continued elite production. In 2024 he threw for 3,731 yards with 28 TD and ran for 531 yards with 12 TD:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}, totaling 385 fantasy points (QB2 overall).

nflPlayers.name: Joe Burrow
nflPlayers.notes: Led the NFL with 4,918 passing yards in 2024:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12} and 43 TD, finishing with ~382 fantasy points (top-3 QB).

nflPlayers.name: Baker Mayfield
nflPlayers.notes: Enjoyed a career resurgence in 2024 with 4,500 yards and 41 TD passes:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}, surprisingly finishing as a top-5 fantasy QB.

nflPlayers.name: Jayden Daniels
nflPlayers.notes: The 2023 Heisman Trophy winner jumped to the NFL and started for Washington in 2024:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}. He amassed 3,568 pass yards, 25 TD, plus 891 rush yards:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}, a dynamic dual-threat rookie season.

nflPlayers.name: Jahmyr Gibbs
nflPlayers.notes: Exploded in 2024 as Detroit's feature back with 1,412 rushing yards and 16 rush TD:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}, plus 517 receiving yards. Gibbs was the top-scoring fantasy RB of 2024.

nflPlayers.name: Saquon Barkley
nflPlayers.notes: Signed with Philadelphia in 2024 and led the league with 2,005 rushing yards:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}. Scored 15 total TDs and was a fantasy superstar again (355 PPR points):contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.

nflPlayers.name: Bijan Robinson
nflPlayers.notes: Built on a strong rookie year with 1,456 rushing yards in 2024:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}. His dual-threat ability (over 1,887 total yards) kept him among the top 3 fantasy RBs.

nflPlayers.name: Derrick Henry
nflPlayers.notes: Thrived after a move to Baltimore in 2024, racking up 1,921 rush yards (5.9 YPC) and 16 TD:contentReference[oaicite:34]{index=34} at age 30. Henry remained an elite fantasy RB in a run-heavy Ravens offense.

nflPlayers.name: De'Von Achane
nflPlayers.notes: Dynamic in Miami's offense. In 2024 he totaled ~1,500 yards (907 rush, 592 receiving) with 11 TD:contentReference[oaicite:37]{index=37}, finishing as a top-5 PPR RB despite splitting touches.

nflPlayers.name: Ja'Marr Chase
nflPlayers.notes: Dominant in 2024 with 1,708 yards and an NFL-best 17 TD receptions:contentReference[oaicite:40]{index=40}. Chase's 127 catches fueled a league-high 403 PPR points, making him the top fantasy WR.

nflPlayers.name: Justin Jefferson
nflPlayers.notes: Another stellar year in 2024: 103 catches, 1,533 yards, 10 TD:contentReference[oaicite:43]{index=43}. Jefferson remained a top-2 fantasy WR, though he was outscored by Chase due to TDs.

nflPlayers.name: Amon-Ra St. Brown
nflPlayers.notes: A PPR machine, Amon-Ra set career highs with 115 receptions and 12 TD in 2024:contentReference[oaicite:46]{index=46}. He remained Jared Goff's top target and a top-3 fantasy WR.

nflPlayers.name: Brian Thomas Jr.
nflPlayers.notes: Drafted by Jacksonville in 2024 (Round 1) and quickly became a key target. Posted 1,282 yards and 10 TD as a rookie:contentReference[oaicite:49]{index=49}, a huge fantasy surprise.

nflPlayers.name: Drake London
nflPlayers.notes: Emerged as Atlanta's clear WR1 by 2024 with 100 catches, 1,271 yards, and 9 TD:contentReference[oaicite:52]{index=52}. Despite Atlanta's run-first offense, London delivered consistent fantasy WR2 value.

nflPlayers.name: Brock Bowers
nflPlayers.notes: Drafted #13 overall in 2024, Bowers immediately became the Raiders' top target. His 112 receptions and 1,194 yards led all TEs:contentReference[oaicite:55]{index=55}, and he earned first-team All-Pro honors as a rookie.

nflPlayers.name: Trey McBride
nflPlayers.notes: Stepped up as Arizona's primary tight end. In 2024 McBride caught 111 passes for 1,146 yards:contentReference[oaicite:58]{index=58} (a huge leap from 2023), finishing as the #2 fantasy TE despite only 2 TDs.

nflPlayers.name: George Kittle
nflPlayers.notes: Remained a top-tier TE. Kittle's 78/1,106/8 receiving line in 2024:contentReference[oaicite:61]{index=61} kept him as a top-3 fantasy tight end, continuing his streak of 1,000+ yard seasons.

nflPlayers.name: Travis Kelce
nflPlayers.notes: Still productive in 2024, but saw a dip in targets and TDs compared to his peak years. Kelce caught 81 passes for 923 yards and 6 TDs.

nflPlayers.name: Jake Ferguson
nflPlayers.notes: Solidified his role as the Cowboys' starting TE, catching 71 passes for 765 yards and 5 TDs in 2024. Reliable TE2 for fantasy.

nflPlayers.name: Brandon Aubrey
nflPlayers.notes: Perfect on field goals in 2024, going 44 for 44. Aubrey led all kickers with 192 fantasy points.

nflPlayers.name: Chris Boswell
nflPlayers.notes: Had perhaps his best season in 2024, hitting 41 of 44 FG attempts (93%):contentReference[oaicite:67]{index=67}. Boswell's 191 points were second only to Aubrey among kickers.

nflPlayers.name: Justin Tucker
nflPlayers.notes: Another reliable season for Tucker, who made 38 of 41 field goals and all 55 extra points. He finished as a top-3 fantasy kicker.

nflPlayers.name: Kansas City Chiefs
nflPlayers.notes: The Chiefs D led the league in sacks (57) and scored 5 defensive TDs, making them the top fantasy DST in 2024.

nflPlayers.name: Cleveland Browns
nflPlayers.notes: A dominant unit, the Browns DST racked up 52 sacks and 20 interceptions, finishing as a top-2 fantasy defense.

nflPlayers.name: Baltimore Ravens
nflPlayers.notes: The Ravens DST remained a strong fantasy option with consistent pressure (48 sacks) and takeaways.
